clinical_study.brief_title: Multispectral Imaging Endoscopy in Digestive Inflammation
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Multispectral Imaging in Digestive Inflammation Diagnosis

primary_outcome.measure: Reflectance endoscopy for gastric mucosa with lesions
primary_outcome.description: The reflectance endoscopy for gastric and rectal mucosa in different wavelength of presence of the lesions, in comparison with anatomopathological analysis on gastric and rectal mucosa, to diagnosis acute and chronic inflammation, glandular atrophy and intestinal metaplasia. This outcome will show reflectance for mucosa in presence of lesions which classified by anatomopathological analysis: comparison report.

secondary_outcome.measure: Statistic association between profiles of reflectance and anatomopathological classifications
secondary_outcome.description: Statistic association between the profiles of reflectance in different frequencies and anatomopathological classifications in stomach and rectal analysis (such as acute or chronic inflammation, glandular atrophy and intestinal metaplasia).

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between reflectance and intensity of inflammation
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between reflectance to different frequencies and intensity of inflammation in stomach (according to the Classification of Sydney) and in rectum (according to Erben et al).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-study: morphological comparison between 2D/3D reconstruction and endoscopist's description
secondary_outcome.description: Morphological comparison between reconstruction in 2D or 3D and morphological description of mucosa (the antra and the cardia) by endoscopist. The type of method as structure from motion (SFM) should be used to map in 3D or 2D the antra, few publication show method of mapping in 3D or 2D for hollow organs, potentially transformable and utilisable under clinical condition.

intervention.description: Record of video-endoscopy sequences and reflectance, during endoscopy with biopsy.
